publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7652 Jackie Baillie: Cameron House Hotel Wins Top Accolade—That the Parliament congratulates Cameron House on being awarded Hotel of the Year 2010 at the prestigious Catey Awards in London; understands that the Loch Lomond hotel beat off competition from all over Scotland, England, Ireland and Wales; notes that the hotel, operated by De Vere Hotels and Resorts, was refurbished at a cost of £50 million last year; further notes that the Carrick Spa at Cameron House recently won the title of Scottish Spa of the Year, adding to a raft of awards for the hotel, and congratulates all the staff for their hard work in securing these accolades, which it believes demonstrates that Loch Lomond continues to be a premier holiday destination.
